Classes

App(G, R[, R_thresh, clustering, node_type])

Creating Dash app
class netflow.app.App(G, R, R_thresh=0.9, clustering=None, node_type=<class 'int'>, **pos_kwargs)[source]#

Creating Dash app

Parameters

  • G (networkx Graph) – The interaction network.

  • R (pandas DataFrame) – Symmetric pairwise correlations between nodes in G.

  • R_thresh (float (R_thresh > 0.)) – Initial correlation threshold.

  • clustering ({None, str}) – Node attribute with cluster ID used to color the nodes

  • selected_graph ({'combo', 'interaction', 'functional'}) – Initial graph to render.

  • node_type ({int, str}) – Data type of node ids.

  • pos_kwargs (dict) – Optional key-word arguments passed to initialize node positions.

__init__(G, R, R_thresh=0.9, clustering=None, node_type=<class 'int'>, **pos_kwargs)[source]#

update_elements(selected_graph, R_thresh)[source]#
upload_graph(contents, names)[source]#
netflow.app.correlation_network(R, condition, name='R')[source]#

Create graph from correlations R that satisfy given condition.

Parameters

  • R (pandas DataFrame) – n by n symmetric correlations, where n is the number of nodes.

  • condition (pandas DataFrame) – Boolean dataframe of the same size and order of rows and columns as df indicating values, where True, to include in the stacked dataframe.

  • name (str) – Name of edge attribute that the correlations are saved as.

Returns

G_R – Graph with edges determined by correlations that satisfy the specified condition.

Return type

networkx Graph

netflow.app.graph_elements(G, G2, show='combo', pos=None, **pos_kwargs)[source]#

put graph elements in JSON format

Note

assumes nodes in G have ids in consecutive order from 0, 1, …, n-1 where n is the number of nodes and that G has node attribute “name” with node label of type str

Note

assumes nodes in G2 are subset of nodes in G with the same ids.

Parameters

  • G (networkx Graph) – The graph and functional graph with correlated edges.

  • G2 (networkx Graph) – The graph and functional graph with correlated edges.

  • show ({'combo', 'interaction', 'functional'}) –

    Select graph elements to show.

    Options :

    • ’combo’ : show interaction and functional network

    • ’interaction’ : only show interaction network

    • ’functional’ : only show functional network

  • pos (dict) – Position of nodes.

  • **pos_kwargs (dict) – Optional key-word arguments passed to node_positions. .. note:: this is ignored if pos is provided.

Returns

elements – dict of graph nodes and edges in JSON format {‘nodes’: [], ‘edges’: []}.

Return type

dict

netflow.app.node_positions(G, bounding_box=(0.0, 0.0, 1400, 650), weight='R', **pos_kwargs)[source]#

get x,y-coordinates of nodes in the graph.

Parameters

  • G (networkx Graph) – The graph.

  • bounding_box (4-tuple) – Tuple of the form (x_min, y_min, x_max, y_max) with the dimensions of the bounding box where the nodes can be positioned.

Returns

pos – A dictionary of positions keyed by node of the form {node: {‘x’: x-coordinate, ‘y’: y-coordinate}}

Return type

dict
